results.title: On the nose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
An introduction to the sense of smell. Animation is used to illustrate the operations of the smell receptors in the nasal cavities and how this information is processed by the brain. Clearly defines the concept of smelling and recognition of odours.

results.title: Spectacular canyons
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Uses diagrams and spectacular photography to introduce the geomorphological agents involved in the creation of canyons. Covers rivers, valleys and glacial valleys showing the processes of weathering and erosion. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Lakes, rivers and other water sources
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Investigates the earth’s major sources of fresh water (lakes, rivers and underground water). The origins of this water, the action of rivers, how lakes clog up, the forces that create the underground water supply and the way in which these major sources of fresh water are interconnected are also considered. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Geysers, lava & hot spots
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Uses the existence of geysers and lava flows as evidence of the heat inside the earth. Investigates the ways in which these hot spots were created and how they are different as well as looking how their energy can be harnessed by humans. Also provides a simple explanation of the formation of the earth.

results.title: Land that came in from the cold
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Shows the ecological succession which has been associated with the retreat of the ice sheet in the Glacier Bay area of southeastern Alaska over the past two hundred years. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Yugoslavia; Hungary
results.creator_credit: William Fitzwater, Fitzwater Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Depicts the experiences of Australian children of various ethnic backgrounds in the country where their parents were born. “Yugoslavia”: Duska Franic discovers her large extended family when visiting her parents’ birthplace in the beautiful Croatian countryside. “Hungary”: Debbie Karp journeys to Budapest, her mother’s birthplace. She visits relatives and tours Hungary on a voyage of discovery.
results.description:

results.title: Jessie Thandi in India; Ellen Youie in China = India; China
results.creator_credit: William Fitzwater, Stephen Cross, Fitzwater Productions, Argosy Films and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Two programs from the series” Through Australian Eyes”. In the first program Australian-born Jessie Thandi journeys to the Punjab region of India, her father’s place of birth in a search for her own identity. In the second program Ellen Youie visits the small Cantonese village where her mother was born, and strengthens the ties she feels with her Chinese heritage.

results.title: Rosemary Agostino in Italy; Angela Sarantis in Greece
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Barinder Productions and Channel 0-28
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Two programs from the series :Through Australian eyes”. In the first program Rosemary Agostino returns to her parents’ birthplace in Calabria. In the small village she becomes aware of the sense of community missing from life in Australia. In the second program Angela Sarantis returns to her father’s village in Kastraki in northern Greece. She sees that many changes have occurred since her parents left their homeland particularly due to the demands of Greece’s main industry, tourism.
